title: Security Advisory for PHP packages hosted at packagist.org
description: Security Advisory for PHP packages hosted at packagist.org on GitHub

items.content_html:
Cross-site Scripting (XSS) - Stored in GitHub repository froxlor/froxlor prior to 2.1.0-dev1.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-5564
  • https://github.com/froxlor/froxlor/commit/e8ed43056c1665522a586e3485da67f2bdf073aa
  • https://huntr.dev/bounties/9254d8f3-a847-4ae8-8477-d2ce027cff5c
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-j5hq-6frc-64v3
items.title: [froxlor/froxlor] Cross-site Scripting (XSS) in froxlor/froxlor

items.content_html:
A vulnerability was found in simplesamlphp simplesamlphp-module-openidprovider up to 0.8.x. It has been declared as problematic. Affected by this vulnerability is an unknown functionality of the file templates/trust.tpl.php. The manipulation of the argument StateID leads to cross site scripting. The attack can be launched remotely. Upgrading to version 0.9.0 is able to address this issue. The name of the patch is 8365d48c863cf06ccf1465cc0a161cefae29d69d. It is recommended to upgrade the affected component. The identifier VDB-218473 was assigned to this vulnerability. NOTE: This vulnerability only affects products that are no longer supported by the maintainer.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2010-10008
  • https://github.com/simplesamlphp/simplesamlphp-module-openidprovider/commit/8365d48c863cf06ccf1465cc0a161cefae29d69d
  • https://github.com/simplesamlphp/simplesamlphp-module-openidprovider/releases/tag/v0.9.0
  • https://vuldb.com/?ctiid.218473
  • https://vuldb.com/?id.218473
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-chgc-rqjr-46gg
items.title: [simplesamlphp/simplesamlphp-module-openidprovider] Cross Site Scripting in simplesamlphp-module-openidprovider

items.content_html:
A vulnerability was found in Information Cards Module and classified as problematic. This issue affects some unknown processing. The manipulation leads to cross site scripting. The attack may be initiated remotely. Upgrading to version 1.0 is able to address this issue. The name of the patch is f6bfea49ae16dc6e179df8306d39c3694f1ef186. It is recommended to upgrade the affected component. The identifier VDB-217661 was assigned to this vulnerability.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2010-10004
  • https://github.com/simplesamlphp/simplesamlphp-module-infocard/commit/f6bfea49ae16dc6e179df8306d39c3694f1ef186
  • https://github.com/simplesamlphp/simplesamlphp-module-infocard/releases/tag/v1.0
  • https://vuldb.com/?ctiid.217661
  • https://vuldb.com/?id.217661
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-2phw-rgr7-5pvh
items.title: [simplesamlphp/simplesamlphp-module-infocard] Information Cards Module vulnerable to Cross-site Scripting

items.content_html:
A vulnerability classified as problematic has been found in SimpleSAMLphp simplesamlphp-module-openid. Affected is an unknown function of the file templates/consumer.php of the component OpenID Handler. The manipulation of the argument AuthState leads to cross site scripting. It is possible to launch the attack remotely. Upgrading to version 1.0 can address this issue. The name of the patch is d652d41ccaf8c45d5707e741c0c5d82a2365a9a3. It is recommended to upgrade the affected component. VDB-217170 is the identifier assigned to this vulnerability.

NOTE: This vulnerability only affects products that are no longer supported by the maintainer.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2010-10002
  • https://github.com/simplesamlphp/simplesamlphp-module-openid/commit/d652d41ccaf8c45d5707e741c0c5d82a2365a9a3
  • https://github.com/simplesamlphp/simplesamlphp-module-openid/releases/tag/v1.0
  • https://vuldb.com/?ctiid.217170
  • https://vuldb.com/?id.217170
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-ggj9-6x8j-49w9
items.title: [simplesamlphp/simplesamlphp-module-openid] SimpleSAMLphp simplesamlphp-module-openid

items.content_html:
Cross-site Scripting (XSS) - Stored in GitHub repository froxlor/froxlor prior to 2.0.22.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-4829
  • https://github.com/froxlor/froxlor/commit/4711a414360782fe4fc94f7c25027077cbcdf73d
  • https://huntr.dev/bounties/babd73ca-6c80-4145-8c7d-33a883fe606b
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-cvwv-h85m-w37h
items.title: [froxlor/froxlor] Cross-site Scripting (XSS) in froxlor/froxlor

items.content_html:
Object state limitation is a policy you can use in your roles to limit access to content based on specific object state values. Due to a flawed earlier update, these limitations were ineffective in releases made since February 16th 2022. They would grant access to the given content regardless of the object state. Depending on how your frontent is designed, knowing the URL to the content may or may not be required to access it. If you are using object state limitations in your roles, this issue is critical. Please apply the fix as soon as possible.

References

  • https://github.com/ezsystems/ezpublish-kernel/security/advisories/GHSA-5x4f-7xgq-r42x
  • https://developers.ibexa.co/security-advisories/ibexa-sa-2022-004-ineffective-object-state-limitation-and-unauthenticated-fastly-purge
  • https://github.com/ezsystems/ezpublish-kernel/commit/133c33cbcaa330953d6283865153f3dfdc7a2e45
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-5x4f-7xgq-r42x
items.title: [ezsystems/ezpublish-kernel] Object state limitation has no effect

items.content_html:
Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF) in GitHub repository snipe/snipe-it prior to v.6.2.3.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-5511
  • https://github.com/snipe/snipe-it/commit/6d55d782806c9660e9e65dc5250faacb5d0033ed
  • https://huntr.dev/bounties/43206801-9862-48da-b379-e55e341d78bf
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-33vj-r6p6-x4p8
items.title: [snipe/snipe-it] Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF) in snipe/snipe-it

items.content_html:
Concrete CMS v9.2.1 is affected by Arbitrary File Upload vulnerability via the Thumbnail file upload, which allows Cross-Site Scripting (XSS).

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-44763
  • https://github.com/sromanhu/ConcreteCMS-Arbitrary-file-upload-Thumbnail
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-wrp2-6v6j-hfmg
items.title: [concrete5/concrete5] ConcreteCMS vulnerable to Stored Cross-site Scripting

items.content_html:
Impact

The JS payload added to the product name may be executed at the storefront when adding a note to the shopping list line item containing a vulnerable product. An attacker should be able to edit a product in the admin area and force a user to add this product to Shopping List and click add a note for it.

References

  • https://github.com/oroinc/orocommerce/security/advisories/GHSA-2jc6-3fhj-8q84
  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2022-35950
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-2jc6-3fhj-8q84
items.title: [oro/commerce] OroCommerce Cross-site Scripting vulnerability in add note dialog of Shopping List line item

items.content_html:
Information Disclosure vulnerability in file module of Drupal Core allows an attacker to gain access to the file metadata of a permanent private file that they do not have access to by guessing the ID of the file. This issue affects: Drupal Core 8.8.x versions prior to 8.8.10; 8.9.x versions prior to 8.9.6; 9.0.x versions prior to 9.0.6.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2020-13670
  • https://www.drupal.org/sa-core-2020-011
  • https://github.com/drupal/core/commit/f93a37b713b59f8d24e826bc74378099853eef3d
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-mmjr-5q74-p3m4
items.title: [drupal/core] Exposure of Resource to Wrong Sphere in Drupal Core

items.content_html:
The QuickEdit module does not properly check access to fields in some circumstances, which can lead to unintended disclosure of field data. Sites are only affected if the QuickEdit module (which comes with the Standard profile) is installed.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2020-13676
  • https://www.drupal.org/sa-core-2021-009
  • https://github.com/drupal/core/commit/8e8e3d2ddd72471ba886346ecabfb5d98fd27d9b
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-qfhg-m6r8-xxpj
items.title: [drupal/core] Incorrect Authorization in Drupal core

items.content_html:
Subrion CMS is vulnerable to cross-site request forgery in blog/delete/. This has been patched in version 4.2.1.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2017-18366
  • https://github.com/intelliants/subrion/issues/477
  • https://github.com/intelliants/subrion/commit/8c08d7b92a4b7b5820a951d53c24844715439b73
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-c939-g732-48r8
items.title: [intelliants/subrion] Subrion CMS vulnerable to CSRF in blog/delete

items.content_html:
Subrion CMS 4.0.5 has CSRF in admin/blocks/add/. The attacker can create any block, and can optionally insert XSS via the content parameter.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2017-6068
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20210126223835/http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/97091
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-q4h5-g3w8-f9x7
items.title: [intelliants/subrion] Subrion CMS vulnerable to CSRF in admin/blocks/add
